reviews.text: I don't usually take the time to post reviews (naughty) but this hotel was such a pleasant surprise, they deserve the praise. Staff were friendly and helpful always. Concierge went absolutely out of his way to help us, making his night manager baby sit our children when the baby sitter didn't turn up on time. We stayed in an immaculate modern 2 bedroom suite which felt like a hotel suite but still had its own kitchenette (with washing machine and dryer built in) and dining area which we so needed to cater for small kids. The room was cleaned every day by staff who even washed up the plates I had left in the kitchen. FYI: The hotel did also had an impressive 3 bedroom apartment with 2 levels (loft style feel) but unfortunately did not suit us because of the floating stairs and our small toddler who would have loved them! Only negative thing I could possibly say is it had a small pool that was a little chilly (not heated) but it was outside with a stunning bar area and our kids did have a lot of fun in it! Fabulous hotel for small kids - for a family of 5 we could not have got better value and been more comfortable.
reviews.title: Worth taking the time to post a review!

reviews.text: This hotel, as you would expect from every 5 star hotel, is in an excellent location with impeccable rooms and stunning decor, has a tranquil spa and a fantastic resturant.

However what really sets the Cape Royale apart is the sincerity of the staff. When staying in a 5*, good service is a given but often feels as though it was learnt from a book and merely applied. It is not often that you find the warmth and sincerity that you get at this hotel.
reviews.title: Not up to the mark

reviews.text: We had a very large 2 room apartment with 2 bathrooms and a full-sized kitchen for our family of 4. Very quiet behind the double-glazing despite the main road setting. You can walk to the V&A waterfront. The hotel looks down to the new stadium and the waterfront. There is a roof top bar and pool - a little windy in the afternoon in Autumn. There are amazing spa rooms and a small gym. The staff were very friendly. The helpful, knowledgable concierge will find you a good restaurant or eat in the hotel's upmarket steak house (good fish and vegetarian options too). Outside the hotel, try Il Leone (Italian), Mama Africa (African with dancing and singing) or 4 Quay (by the waterfront). I recomend the hotel especially for a family that needs 2 rooms together.
reviews.title: Expect a luxury apartment not just a room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited 28-31 May 2010. The hotel is imposing and beautiful, right across the road from the gorgeous new soccer stadium. Rooms are spacious, but not homely - there's even an echo in the large 2-bedroom suites and upon arrival we were greeted by an orange dustcloth on a shelf that had not been removed by the night cleaner on our arrival day either. Second day when we got back the duster was gone but a dirty towel had been left in the bath - not really what you expect from 5*. Also had a cleaner show up before our breakfast had arrived to ask if we want the room cleaned - yes, but when we're out not when we're eating! We had room service and snacks all 3 nights: food is not the best: burger was watery and caesar salad completely drenched in dressing (1800 degrees downstairs does the same caesar salad but it was so much better - the best caesar salad I've ever had actually, just the room service one was poor). Breakfast was ok, but not great: I ordered smoked salmon and scrambled eggs which in Europe means you get smoked salmon and scrambled eggs, not f r i e d smoked salmon and scrambled eggs together. One of the soups of the day did not change during our duration there, leek and potato.
reviews.title: Great hotel - but beware the room service food and cleaners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel car service is fantastic, drivers are knowledgeable and friendly and we felt very safe and looked after. Also the waitron Carlos (Albanian I think) from 1800 degrees was so lovely, very friendly and a nice person. Staff in general were very nice and polite. The kitchen had facilities for making toast, a blender, good coffee and crockery and cutlery, everything except for pots and pans in fact! So if one wants to cook there, s/he can only make use of the glass oven dishes provided.

reviews.text: We're going back in August and considering staying again, overall a very good experience, perhaps just not too good a value for money bearing in mind the food and cleaners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into a 2 bedroom suite that comes highly recommended with views of the stadium and the city. The kitchen was fully equipped with no detail missed. Often with self-catering apartments in hotels there is oversight with regard to the type of crockery and various utensils needed but omitted. However, this was certainly NOT the case with Cape Royale- whereby every imaginable utensil was available. The layout of the room was exquisite with opulent touches that made this city breakaway extremely memorable. Well worth the price!
reviews.title: 5 star calibre service with 6 star touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cape Royale offers luxury, comfort, a wonderful restaurant, concireges that can make everything happen immediately and service in room within a moments touch of the room-phone. This is a hotel highlight of the highest standards if located anywhere in the world. The personal welcoming service is heart warming. The concierge staff is incredible and the luxury car service to various points of interest is impeccable. Peter Mayer, a celebrated tour guide in the Cape Town area, was extraordinary taking us to points of interest we wanted to go to and many other hidden gems we were able to embellish with his expertise. We give Cape Royal all the stars it well deserves and are very appreciative of all its personal and refined touches. Very impressive!
reviews.title: Absoutely extraordinary and such a personal touch 24 hours a day. Elegant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very simply, our recent stay at the Cape Royale Luxury Hotel in Cape Town far surpassed any preconceived ideas we might have had upfront - especially from a hotel appealing to both the tourist and business traveller - and at the somewhat frenetic time during the lead-up to the 2010 Soccer World Cup. The service, the facilities, the attitude of the staff was all superb - I'd highly recommend it - from an already admirably high base, it can only get better and better as it becomes more established.
reviews.title: "SURPASSED WHAT IT PROMISES IN EVERY WAY"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In January, we stayed two nights in the Cape Royale in Cape Town. What an exciting place! We really liked everything in this hotel (especially the upgrade to a suite). The room, the amazing restaurant (called 1800 degrees), the roofterrace (good cocktails!) and the people in the hotel. The concierge Madnee (the older man) helped us very well. When we left Cape Royale for a week in the wineregion, he advised us about good restaurants and other places in and around the city of Franschhoek. Thanks!
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Cape Town!

reviews.text: Travelled to Cape Town with a 8 guys in Jan 2010 on golf and fun holiday, stayed in the Cape Royale hotel for the second time, its a wonderful hotel. The new steak house restaurant 1800 hundred degrees was simply outstanding, the food was superb, service excellent and value for money incredible. This is a top end steak house to rival anything in the world with Cape Town charm and hospitality, cant wait to go back. My favourite was the 400 gram fillet steak cooked medium rare came with trimmings for less than 20 euro.
